DocsAPIGuidesRustPlayground

Build faster with PhilJS

A modern web framework with fine-grained reactivity, TypeScript-first APIs, and optional Rust integration for maximum performance.

Get StartedTry Playground
v2.0 ReleasedMIT LicenseGitHub
TypeScript
1import { signal, effect } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function Counter() {
4  const count = signal(0);
5 
6  effect(() => {
7    console.log('Count is now:', count());
8  });
9 
10  return (
11    <button onClick={() => count.set(c => c + 1)}>
12      Clicks: {count}
13    </button>
14  );
15}
Rust (Optional)
1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3#[component]
4fn Counter() -> Element {
5    let count = use_signal(|| 0);
6 
7    view! {
8        <button on:click=move |_| count.set(|c| c + 1)>
9            "Clicks: " {count}
10        </button>
11    }
12}

Everything you need

A complete toolkit for building modern web applications

Fine-Grained Reactivity

Signals-based reactivity with automatic dependency tracking. Only the parts that change get updated.

TypeScript First

Built from the ground up with TypeScript. Full type inference for components, routes, and forms.

JSX You Know

Familiar JSX syntax with powerful enhancements. Works with your existing mental model.

Optional Rust Integration

Compile to WebAssembly with cargo-philjs for maximum performance. Same components, more speed.

Islands Architecture

Ship minimal JavaScript. Hydrate only interactive components for lightning-fast pages.

Developer Experience

Hot Module Replacement, DevTools, comprehensive error messages. Built for productivity.

Get started in seconds

# Create a new PhilJS project
$ npm create philjs@latest my-app

# Or with Rust support
$ cargo philjs new my-app

Set up PhilJS in your project

PhilJS

A modern web framework built for performance and developer experience. Open source under the MIT license.
